name: boot
description:
The `boot` initializer boots up the admin app. It initializes some app
globals, mounts components to the page, and begins routing.

name: routes
description: The `routes` initializer defines the admin app's routes.

name: history
description:
The app's history stack, which keeps track of which routes the user visits
so that they can easily navigate back to the previous route.

name: pane
description: An object which controls the state of the page's side pane.

name: search
description: The page's search component instance.

name: drawer
description: An object which controls the state of the page's drawer.

name: postComponents
description: A map of post types to their components.

name: notificationComponents
description: A map of notification types to their components.

name: composingReplyTo
description:
Check whether or not the user is currently composing a reply to a
discussion.

name: viewingDiscussion
description: Check whether or not the user is currently viewing a discussion.

name: ComposerButton
description:
The `ComposerButton` component displays a button suitable for the composer
controls.

name: DiscussionRenamedNotification
description:
The `DiscussionRenamedNotification` component displays a notification which
indicates that a discussion has had its title changed.

### Props

- All of the props for Notification

name: Page
description: The `Page` component

name: bodyClass
description: A class name to apply to the body while the route is active.

name: SearchSource
description:
The `SearchSource` interface defines a section of search results in the
search dropdown.

Search sources should be registered with the `Search` component instance
(app.search) by extending the `sourceItems` method. When the user types a
query, each search source will be prompted to load search results via the
`search` method. When the dropdown is redrawn, it will be constructed by
putting together the output from the `view` method of each source.

name: search
description: Make a request to get results for the given query.

name: view
description:
Get an array of virtual <li>s that list the search results for the given
query.

name: boot
description:
The `boot` initializer boots up the forum app. It initializes some app
globals, mounts components to the page, and begins routing.

name: components
description:
The `components` initializer registers components to display the default post
types, activity types, and notifications type with the application.

name: routes
description: The `routes` initializer defines the forum app's routes.

name: History
description:
The `History` class keeps track and manages a stack of routes that the user
has navigated to in their session.

An item can be pushed to the top of the stack using the `push` method. An
item in the stack has a name and a URL. The name need not be unique; if it is
the same as the item before it, that will be overwritten with the new URL. In
this way, if a user visits a discussion, and then visits another discussion,
popping the history stack will still take them back to the discussion list
rather than the previous discussion.

name: stack
description: The stack of routes that have been navigated to.

name: getTop
description: Get the item on the top of the stack.

name: push
description: Push an item to the top of the stack.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the route.

params.name: url
params.description:
The URL of the route. The current URL will be used if
    not provided.

name: canGoBack
description: Check whether or not the history stack is able to be popped.

name: back
description: Go back to the previous route in the history stack.

name: backUrl
description: Get the URL of the previous page.

name: home
description: Go to the first route in the history stack.

name: Pane
description:
The `Pane` class manages the page's discussion list sidepane. The pane is a
part of the content view (DiscussionPage component), but its visibility is
determined by CSS classes applied to the outer page element. This class
manages the application of those CSS classes.

name: pinnedKey
description: The localStorage key to store the pane's pinned state with.

name: $element
description: The page element.

name: pinned
description: Whether or not the pane is currently pinned.

name: active
description: Whether or not the pane is currently exists.

name: showing
description:
Whether or not the pane is currently showing, or is hidden off the edge
of the screen.

name: enable
description: Enable the pane.

name: disable
description: Disable the pane.

name: show
description: Show the pane.

name: hide
description: Hide the pane.

name: onmouseleave
description:
Begin a timeout to hide the pane, which can be cancelled by showing the
pane.

name: togglePinned
description: Toggle whether or not the pane is pinned.

name: render
description: Apply the appropriate CSS classes to the page element.

name: affixSidebar
description:
Setup the sidebar DOM element to be affixed to the top of the viewport
using Bootstrap's affix plugin.

name: slidable
description:
The `slidable` utility adds touch gestures to an element so that it can be
slid away to reveal controls underneath, and then released to activate those
controls.

It relies on the element having children with particular CSS classes.
TODO: document

properties.name: reset
properties.description:
Revert the slider to its original position. This
    should be called, for example, when a controls dropdown is closed.

name: App
description:
The `App` class provides a container for an application, as well as various
utilities for the rest of the app to use.

name: forum
description: The forum model for this application.

name: routes
description:
A map of routes, keyed by a unique route name. Each route is an object
containing the following properties:

- `path` The path that the route is accessed at.
- `component` The Mithril component to render when this route is active.

name: preload
description: An object containing data to preload into the application.

properties.name: preload.data
properties.description:
An array of resource objects to preload
    into the data store.

properties.name: preload.document
properties.description:
An API response document to be used
    by the route that is first activated.

properties.name: preload.session
properties.description:
A response from the /api/token
    endpoint containing the session's authentication token and user ID.

name: initializers
description: An ordered list of initializers to bootstrap the application.

name: session
description: The app's session.

name: translator
description: The app's translator.

name: store
description: The app's data store.

name: cache
description:
A local cache that can be used to store data at the application level, so
that is persists between different routes.

name: booted
description: Whether or not the app has been booted.

name: requestError
description:
An Alert that was shown as a result of an AJAX request error. If present,
it will be dismissed on the next successful request.

name: boot
description: Boot the application by running all of the registered initializers.

name: preloadedDocument
description: Get the API response document that has been preloaded into the application.

name: setTitle
description: Set the <title> of the page.

params.name: separator
params.description:
Whether or not to separate the given title and
    the forum's title.

name: setTitleCount
description: Set a number to display in the <title> of the page.

name: request
description: Make an AJAX request, handling any low-level errors that may occur.

name: alertErrors
description: Show alert error messages for each error returned in an API response.

name: route
description: Construct a URL to the route with the given name.

name: trans
description: Shortcut to translate the given key.

name: Component
description:
The `Component` class defines a user interface 'building block'. A component
can generate a virtual DOM to be rendered on each redraw.

An instance's virtual DOM can be retrieved directly using the {@link
Component#render} method.

name: props
description: The properties passed into the component.

name: element
description: The root DOM element for the component.

name: init
description: Called when the component is constructed.

name: onunload
description:
Called when the component is destroyed, i.e. after a redraw where it is no
longer a part of the view.

name: render
description:
Get the renderable virtual DOM that represents the component's view.

This should NOT be overridden by subclasses. Subclasses wishing to define
their virtual DOM should override Component#view instead.
examples:
this.myComponentInstance = new MyComponent({foo: 'bar'});
return m('div', this.myComponentInstance.render());

description:
Returns a jQuery object for this component's element. If you pass in a
selector string, this method will return a jQuery object, using the current
element as its buffer.

For example, calling `component.$('li')` will return a jQuery object
containing all of the `li` elements inside the DOM element of this
component.

unknown.tagValue: {jQuery} the jQuery object for the DOM node

params.name: selector
params.description: a jQuery-compatible selector string

return.description: the jQuery object for the DOM node

name: config
description:
Called after the component's root element is redrawn. This hook can be used
to perform any actions on the DOM, both on the initial draw and any
subsequent redraws. See Mithril's documentation for more information.

name: view
description: Get the virtual DOM that represents the component's view.

name: component
description: Get a Mithril component object for this component, preloaded with props.

params.name: props
params.description: Properties to set on the component

properties.name: props
properties.description: The props that were passed to the component

name: initProps
description: Initialize the component's props.

name: Model
description:
The `Model` class represents a local data resource. It provides methods to
persist changes via the API.

params.name: data
params.description: A resource object from the API.

params.name: store
params.description: The data store that this model should be persisted to.

name: data
description: The resource object from the API.

name: freshness
description:
The time at which the model's data was last updated. Watching the value
of this property is a fast way to retain/cache a subtree if data hasn't
changed.

name: exists
description: Whether or not the resource exists on the server.

name: store
description: The data store that this resource should be persisted to.

name: id
description: Get the model's ID.

name: attribute
description: Get one of the model's attributes.

name: pushData
description: Merge new data into this model locally.

params.name: data
params.description: A resource object to merge into this model

name: pushAttributes
description: Merge new attributes into this model locally.

params.name: attributes
params.description: The attributes to merge.

name: save
description: Merge new attributes into this model, both locally and with persistence.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attributes to save. If a 'relationships' key
    exists, it will be extracted and relationships will also be saved.

name: delete
description: Send a request to delete the resource.

params.name: data
params.description: Data to send along with the DELETE request.

name: apiEndpoint
description: Construct a path to the API endpoint for this resource.

name: attribute
description: Generate a function which returns the value of the given attribute.

params.name: transform
params.description: A function to transform the attribute value

name: hasOne
description:
Generate a function which returns the value of the given has-one
relationship.

return.description:
false if no information about the
    relationship exists; undefined if the relationship exists but the model
    has not been loaded; or the model if it has been loaded.

name: hasMany
description:
Generate a function which returns the value of the given has-many
relationship.

return.description:
false if no information about the relationship
    exists; an array if it does, containing models if they have been
    loaded, and undefined for those that have not.

name: transformDate
description: Transform the given value into a Date object.

name: getRelationshipData
description: Get a relationship data object for the given model.

name: Session
description:
The `Session` class defines the current user session. It stores a reference
to the current authenticated user, and provides methods to log in/out.

name: user
description: The current authenticated user.

name: token
description: The token that was used for authentication.

name: login
description: Attempt to log in a user.

params.name: identification
params.description: The username/email.

name: logout
description: Log the user out.

name: authorize
description:
Apply an authorization header with the current token to the given
XMLHttpRequest object.

name: Store
description:
The `Store` class defines a local data store, and provides methods to
retrieve data from the API.

name: data
description:
The local data store. A tree of resource types to IDs, such that
accessing data[type][id] will return the model for that type/ID.

name: models
description:
The model registry. A map of resource types to the model class that
should be used to represent resources of that type.

name: pushPayload
description: Push resources contained within an API payload into the store.

return.description:
The model(s) representing the resource(s) contained
    within the 'data' key of the payload.

name: pushObject
description:
Create a model to represent a resource object (or update an existing one),
and push it into the store.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource object

return.description:
The model, or null if no model class has been
    registered for this resource type.

name: find
description: Make a request to the API to find record(s) of a specific type.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: id
params.description:
The ID(s) of the model(s) to retreive.
    Alternatively, if an object is passed, it will be handled as the
    `query` parameter.

name: getById
description: Get a record from the store by ID.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: id
params.description: The resource ID.

name: getBy
description: Get a record from the store by the value of a model attribute.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the method on the model.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the model attribute.

name: all
description: Get all loaded records of a specific type.

name: remove
description: Remove the given model from the store.

name: createRecord
description: Create a new record of the given type.

params.name: type
params.description: The resource type

params.name: data
params.description: Any data to initialize the model with

name: Translator
description: The `Translator` class translates strings using the loaded localization.

name: translations
description: A map of translation keys to their translated values.

name: plural
description:
Determine the key of a translation that should be used for the given count.
The default implementation is for English plurals. It should be overridden
by a locale's JavaScript file if necessary.

name: trans
description: Translate a string.

name: LinkButton
description:
The `LinkButton` component defines a `Button` which links to a route.

### Props

All of the props accepted by `Button`, plus:

- `active` Whether or not the page that this button links to is currently
  active.
- `href` The URL to link to. If the current URL `m.route()` matches this,
  the `active` prop will automatically be set to true.

name: isActive
description: Determine whether a component with the given props is 'active'.

name: Switch
description:
The `Switch` component is a `Checkbox`, but with a switch display instead of
a tick/cross one.

name: extend
description:
Extend an object's method by running its output through a mutating callback
every time it is called.

The callback accepts the method's return value and should perform any
mutations directly on this value. For this reason, this function will not be
effective on methods which return scalar values (numbers, strings, booleans).

Care should be taken to extend the correct object  in most cases, a class'
prototype will be the desired target of extension, not the class itself.

params.name: object
params.description: The object that owns the method

params.name: method
params.description: The name of the method to extend

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback which mutates the method's output

name: override
description:
Override an object's method by replacing it with a new function, so that the
new function will be run every time the object's method is called.

The replacement function accepts the original method as its first argument,
which is like a call to 'super'. Any arguments passed to the original method
are also passed to the replacement.

Care should be taken to extend the correct object  in most cases, a class'
prototype will be the desired target of extension, not the class itself.

params.name: object
params.description: The object that owns the method

params.name: method
params.description: The name of the method to override

params.name: newMethod
params.description: The method to replace it with

name: highlight
description:
The `highlight` helper searches for a word phrase in a string, and wraps
matches with the <mark> tag.

params.name: string
params.description: The string to highlight.

params.name: phrase
params.description: The word or words to highlight.

params.name: length
params.description:
The number of characters to truncate the string to.
    The string will be truncated surrounding the first match.

name: punctuate
description:
The `punctuate` helper formats a list of strings (e.g. names) to read
fluently in the application's locale.

name: humanTime
description:
The `humanTime` initializer sets up a loop every 1 second to update
timestamps rendered with the `humanTime` helper.

name: preload
description:
The `preload` initializer creates the application session and preloads it
with data that has been set on the application's `preload` property. It also
preloads any data on the application's `preload` property into the store.
Finally, it sets the application's `forum` instance to the one that was
preloaded.

`app.preload.session` should be the same as the response from the /api/token
endpoint: it should contain `token` and `userId` keys.

name: store
description:
The `store` initializer creates the application's data store and registers
the default resource types to their models.

name: removePost
description: Remove a post from the discussion's posts relationship.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the post to remove.

name: unreadCount
description:
Get the estimated number of unread posts in this discussion for the current
user.

name: badges
description: Get the Badge components that apply to this discussion.

name: postIds
description: Get a list of all of the post IDs in this discussion.

name: isOnline
description: Check whether or not the user has been seen in the last 5 minutes.

name: badges
description: Get the Badge components that apply to this user.

name: calculateAvatarColor
description:
Calculate the dominant color of the user's avatar. The dominant color will
be set to the `avatarColor` property once it has been calculated.

name: savePreferences
description: Update the user's preferences.

name: Drawer
description:
The `Drawer` class controls the page's drawer. The drawer is the area the
slides out from the left on mobile devices; it contains the header and the
footer.

name: isOpen
description: Check whether or not the drawer is currently open.

name: hide
description: Hide the drawer.

name: show
description: Show the drawer.

name: ItemList
description:
The `ItemList` class collects items and then arranges them into an array
by priority.

name: add
description: Add an item to the list.

params.name: key
params.description: A unique key for the item.

params.name: content
params.description: The item's content.

params.name: priority
params.description:
The priority of the item. Items with a higher
    priority will be positioned before items with a lower priority.

name: merge
description: Merge another list's items into this one.

name: toArray
description:
Convert the list into an array of item content arranged by priority. Each
item's content will be assigned an `itemName` property equal to the item's
unique key.

name: ScrollListener
description:
The `ScrollListener` class sets up a listener that handles window scroll
events.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback to run when the scroll position
    changes.

name: loop
description:
On each animation frame, as long as the listener is active, run the
`update` method.

name: update
description: Check if the scroll position has changed; if it has, run the handler.

params.name: force
params.description:
Whether or not to force the handler to be
    run, even if the scroll position hasn't changed.

name: start
description: Start listening to and handling the window's scroll position.

name: stop
description: Stop listening to and handling the window's scroll position.

name: SubtreeRetainer
description:
The `SubtreeRetainer` class represents a Mithril virtual DOM subtree. It
keeps track of a number of pieces of data, allowing the subtree to be
retained if none of them have changed.

params.name: callbacks
params.description: Functions returning data to keep track of.

name: retain
description:
Return a virtual DOM directive that will retain a subtree if no data has
changed since the last check.

name: check
description: Add another callback to be checked.

name: invalidate
description: Invalidate the subtree, forcing it to be rerendered.

name: abbreviateNumber
description: The `abbreviateNumber` utility converts a number to a shorter localized form.

name: anchorScroll
description:
The `anchorScroll` utility saves the scroll position relative to an element,
and then restores it after a callback has been run.

This is useful if a redraw will change the page's content above the viewport.
Normally doing this will result in the content in the viewport being pushed
down or pulled up. By wrapping the redraw with this utility, the scroll
position can be anchor to an element that is in or below the viewport, so
the content in the viewport will stay the same.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to anchor the scroll position to.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run that will change page content.

name: classList
description:
The `classList` utility creates a list of class names by joining an object's
keys, but only for values which are truthy.
examples:
classList({ foo: true, bar: false, qux: 'qaz' });
// "foo qux"

name: computed
description:
The `computed` utility creates a function that will cache its output until
any of the dependent values are dirty.

params.name: dependentKeys
params.description: The keys of the dependent values.

params.name: compute
params.description:
The function which computes the value using the
    dependent values.

name: extract
description:
The `extract` utility deletes a property from an object and returns its
value.

params.name: object
params.description: The object that owns the property

params.name: property
params.description: The name of the property to extract

name: extractText
description: Extract the text nodes from a virtual element.

name: formatNumber
description:
The `formatNumber` utility localizes a number into a string with the
appropriate punctuation.

name: humanTime
description:
The `humanTime` utility converts a date to a localized, human-readable time-
ago string.

name: mapRoutes
description:
The `mapRoutes` utility converts a map of named application routes into a
format that can be understood by Mithril.

name: mixin
description:
The `mixin` utility assigns the properties of a set of 'mixin' objects to
the prototype of a parent object.
examples: class MyClass extends mixin(ExtistingClass, evented, etc) {}

params.name: Parent
params.description: The class to extend the new class from.

params.name: mixins
params.description: The objects to mix in.

return.description: A new class that extends Parent and contains the mixins.

name: truncate
description: Truncate a string to the given length, appending ellipses if necessary.

name: slug
description:
Create a slug out of the given string. Non-alphanumeric characters are
converted to hyphens.

name: getPlainContent
description:
Strip HTML tags and quotes out of the given string, replacing them with
meaningful punctuation.

name: ucfirst
description: Make a string's first character uppercase.

name: stringToColor
description: Convert the given string to a unique color.

content:
# Flarum JS API Docs

[Flarum](http://github.com/flarum/core)'s JS API Docs serve the purpose to help contributors contribute to Flarum, and extension developers to extend it as well.

## Contributing

Interested in contributing to Flarum? Please read the [Contributing docs](http://flarum.org/docs/contributing) to learn how you can help.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "flarum",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Flarum PHP & JS API Documentation",
  "main": "index.js",
  "repository": "https://github.com/datitisev/FlarumAPIDocs.git",
  "author": "David Sevilla Martin <dsevilla192@icloud.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "dependencies": {
    "cli": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-exclude-source-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^0.0.1",
    "esdoc-lint-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "progressbar": "^1.1.1"
  }
}
name: package.json
